snippet: The European plane maker has taken a foothold in a country whose carriers, for historical reasons, have long flown Boeing aircraft almost exclusively.
abstract: Airbus announces $9.5 billion order from Japan Airlines for 31 A350 wide-body jets; deal could signal weakness in Boeing's marketing and potentially threaten some of Boeing's relationships in Japanese market it has dominated for decades.

byline.original: By CHRISTOPHER DREW and ERIC PFANNER
byline.contributor: Nicola Clark and Hisako Ueno contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The European plane maker has taken a foothold in a country whose carriers, for historical reasons, have long flown Boeing aircraft almost exclusively.

headline.main: Japan Airlines Deal With Airbus Is Blow in Boeing Stronghold
headline.print_headline: Japan Airlines Deal With Airbus Is Blow In Boeing Stronghold
